ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I gained the skills to discuss political and cultural issues in modern Hebrew.
An extremely nuanced, deep and comprehensive understanding of Israel, its people and its systems- all while improving my Hebrew drastically.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: There are a lot of assignments!

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Definitely take this course if you want to talk about politics and society in Hebrew.

This course is a must for all Hebrew speakers and those who want to work on their Hebrew. I think that this course should be required for the Hebrew certificate as it teaches us so much about the language and those who speak it like no other Hebrew class at Yale does. It is an amazing wrap-up course for the certificate and it is so incredibly comprehensive.
